headline.main: How One Hospital Bent the Cost Curve

docs.abstract: Many economists and specialists think that changes made by insurers, hospitals and doctors to emphasize the quality of care rather than the quantity of care is a factor in slowing health care costs, and Children's Hospital Boston offers a good test case.
docs.snippet: Many economists and specialists think that changes made by insurers, hospitals and doctors to emphasize the quality of care rather than the quantity of care is a factor in slowing health care costs, and Children's Hospital Boston offers a good test...

docs.lead_paragraph: With the big 6-0 just days away, taking stock of savings and retirement plans can be quite sobering.
docs.abstract: Joe Nocera Op-Ed column shares his personal experience to illustrate how linking investing and retirement is often a recipe for disaster.
docs.snippet: With the big 6-0 just days away, taking stock of savings and retirement plans can be quite sobering.

docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has boasted of historic accomplishments almost every week since he became governor, even though some of the achievements are short of earthshaking.

headline.seo: Cuomo Says He Makes History, Then Repeats It
headline.main: Cuomo Says He Makes History, Then Repeats It
headline.print_headline: Cuomo Says He Makes History, Then Repeats It

docs.abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo frequently offers play-by-play commentary on his accomplishments, issuing press releases and making speeches that describe yet another 'historic' or 'transformational' action from his administration; some critics say that his frequent use of such glowing terms comes at the risk of ringing hollow and undercutting credibility.
docs.snippet: Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo has boasted of historic accomplishments almost every week since he became governor, even though some of the achievements are short of earthshaking.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mitt Romney is trying to shift the debate away from the harsh immigration rhetoric of the primaries to focus on jobs and the economy.

headline.seo: Florida’s Crucial Hispanic Voters Are Wary of Romney
headline.main: Crucial to Romney, Florida’s Latino Voters Are Wary of Him, Too
headline.print_headline: Crucial to Romney, Florida’s Latino Voters Are Wary of Him, Too

docs.abstract: Mitt Romney, the presumptive Republican presidential nominee, is trying to shift the debate away from his hawkish stance on immigration to focus on jobs and the economy in key battleground state of Florida; state is home to growing numbers of non-Cuban Hispanics who are receptive to Republicans' economic and social views, but are reluctant to back the party in part because of its stance on illegal immigration.
docs.snippet: Mitt Romney is trying to shift the debate away from the harsh immigration rhetoric of the primaries to focus on jobs and the economy.

docs.lead_paragraph: The inquiry would focus on whether Accretive Health violated a federal law that requires hospitals to provide emergency care regardless of citizenship, legal status or the ability to pay.

headline.seo: In Congress, Stark of California Seeks Inquiry Into Accretive Health
headline.main: In Congress, a Move to Look Into a Medical Debt Collector
headline.print_headline: In Congress, a Move to Look Into a Medical Debt Collector

docs.abstract: Congressman Pete Stark of California is calling for an investigation into Accretive Health, one of the nation's largest collectors of medical debt, for potentially violating a federal law requiring hospitals to provide emergency care regardless of citizenship, legal status or the ability to pay; doctors have complained that the company's tactics might be discouraging patients from seeking emergency care.
docs.snippet: The inquiry would focus on whether Accretive Health violated a federal law that requires hospitals to provide emergency care regardless of citizenship, legal status or the ability to pay.

docs.lead_paragraph: A selected guide to walks, talks, exhibitions and other events in New York.
docs.snippet: A selected guide to walks, talks, exhibitions and other events in New York.

headline.main: Rebates for Some Who Buy Own Health Insurance

docs.abstract: About one-third of people who buy their own health insurance are expected to get premium rebates this summer, an analysis of state data finds.
docs.snippet: About one-third of people who buy their own health insurance are expected to get premium rebates this summer, an analysis of state data finds.

docs.snippet: Corrections appearing in print on April 26, 2012.

docs.lead_paragraph: The defeat of two conservative Pennsylvania representatives, Jason Altmire and Tim Holden, by more liberal opponents foreshadows an even more polarized Congress next year.

headline.main: 2 House Democrats Defeated After Opposing Health Law
headline.print_headline: 2 House Democrats Defeated After Opposing Health Law

docs.abstract: Defeat of conservative Reps Jason Altmire and Tim Holden in Pennsylvania by more liberal opponents Rep Mark Critz and newcomer Matt Cartwright in state's primary foreshadows an even more polarized Congress in 2013 in the aftermath of the latest round of redistricting; Altmire and Holden opposed the new health care law, illustrating the strong hold the law has over committed Democratic voters.
docs.snippet: The defeat of two conservative Pennsylvania representatives, Jason Altmire and Tim Holden, by more liberal opponents foreshadows an even more polarized Congress next year.
